tit.e: Kamameshi (cooked rice in an iron pot)
tit.cmt: (cooked rice in an iron pot) を追記しました。
tit.e: Kamameshi (cooked rice in an iron pot)

sen.j: 釜飯（かまめし）は、米に醤油、みりん等の調味料を加え、その上にシイタケ、鶏肉などの具を載せ、一人用の釜で炊いた飯料理である。
sen.e: Kamameshi is a rice dish cooked in an individual pot, seasoned with shoyu (soy sauce) and mirin (sweet sake) with ingredients such as shiitake mushrooms and chicken put on the top of the rice.
Kamameshi is a rice dish cooked in an individual pot, seasoned with soy sauce and mirin (sweet sake) with ingredients such as shiitake mushrooms and chicken on top.
sen.cmt: shoyu () を削除しました。put on the top of the rice を on top に修正しました。
sen.e: Kamameshi is a rice dish cooked in an individual pot, seasoned with soy sauce and mirin (sweet sake) with ingredients such as shiitake mushrooms and chicken on top.

sen.j: 一種の炊き込みご飯であるが、釜から食器椀によそうのではなく、釜のまま食卓に供することに特徴がある。
sen.e: It is a kind of takikomi-gohan (rice cooked with various ingredients) and is characteristically, like a casserole, served as a pot on the dining table instead of as a bowl with rice from the pot.
sen.cmt: 意味を補うため、「casserole」を加えました
sen.e: It is a kind of takikomi-gohan (rice cooked with various ingredients) and is characteristically, like a casserole, served as a pot on the dining table instead of as a bowl with rice from the pot.
It is a kind of takikomi-gohan (rice cooked with various ingredients) and is characteristically, like a casserole, served as a pot on the dining table instead of as a bowl with rice from the pot.

sen.j: 釜の種類としては、写真にあるような羽釜式の鉄釜の他に、土鍋型の陶器の益子焼、高田焼もよく用いられる。
sen.e: Regarding types of kama (a cooking pot for rice), besides iron pots as hagama (old type of pot for a hearth) as shown in the picture, earthware pots, Mashiko-yaki ware or Kouda-yaki ware are often used.

Regarding types of kama (a cooking pot for rice), besides iron pots of hagama style (old type of pot for a hearth) as shown in the picture, earthware pots like Mashiko-yaki or Koda-yaki are also often used.

Regarding types of kama (a cooking pot for rice), besides iron pots of hagama style (old type of pot for a hearth) as shown in the picture, earthware pots like Mashiko-yaki or Koda-yaki are also often used.

sen.j: 米調理米を用意し、具と共に器に盛る
sen.e: Prepare cooking rice and ingredients and put them in the pot.
Prepare cooking rice and ingredients and put them in the pot.
Prepare cooking rice and ingredients and put them in the pot.

sen.j: 水に醤油、料理酒、みりん、コンブなどを加え、味を調える。
sen.e: Add shoyu, cooking saki, mirin, konbu (a seeweed for broth), and like that to water for seasoning.
Add soy sauce, ryorishu (cooking sake), mirin (sweet cooking rice wine), konbu (a seeweed for broth), and so on to water for seasoning.
Add soy sauce, ryorishu (cooking sake), mirin (sweet cooking rice wine), konbu (a seeweed for broth), and so on to water for seasoning.

sen.j: 強火で出汁が吹きこぼれるまで（5分程度）炊く。
sen.e: Boil the rice on high heat until the broth starts boiling over (about 5 minutes).
Boil the rice on high heat until the broth starts boiling over (about 5 minutes).
Boil the rice on high heat until the broth starts boiling over (about 5 minutes).

sen.j: 水気が無くなってきたら蓋を完全に閉め10分から15分ほど蒸らす。
sen.e: When it is almost dry, cover completely and steam for about 10 minutes to 15 minutes.
When it is almost dry, cover completely and steam for about 10 to 15 minutes.
sen.cmt: 10 minutes を 10 に修正しました。
sen.e: When it is almost dry, cover completely and steam for about 10 to 15 minutes.

tit.e: Kamameshi as ekiben (box lunch sold on a train or at a station)
tit.cmt: train lunch を ekiben (box lunch sold on a train or at a station) に修正しました。
tit.e: Kamameshi as ekiben (box lunch sold on a train or at a station)

sen.j: 釜飯は駅弁としても親しまれている。
sen.e: Kamameshi is also well-known as train lunch.
Kamameshi is also well-known as ekiben.
sen.cmt: train lunch を ekiben に修正しました。
sen.e: Kamameshi is also well-known as ekiben.

sen.j: この場合主に土鍋型陶製容器が用いられる。
sen.e: In this case, pottery containers of casserole type are used.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: In this case, pottery containers of casserole type are mainly used.
sen.cmt: 「主に」訳漏れのため mainly を補って対応しました。
sen.e: In this case, pottery containers of casserole type are mainly used.

sen.j: 食べ終わった後の容器を家庭に持ち帰って利用することもできる（少量の粥などを調理するのに便利）。
sen.e: After lunch, the empty containers can be utilized in the home kitchen. (it is convenient to cook a small amount of rice porridge)
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: After lunch, the empty containers can be utilized in the home kitchen (it is convenient to cook a small amount of rice porridge).
sen.cmt: ピリオドを文末に移動しました。
sen.e: After lunch, the empty containers can be utilized in the home kitchen (it is convenient to cook a small amount of rice porridge).

sen.j: 以前は補助機関車の連結・解結のため全ての旅客列車が長時間停車していた（碓氷峠鉄道参照）。
sen.e: In old time, in the Usuitoge Line, all the passanger train were stopped for a long time at the station because attachment and release of the bank engine were operated there.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処「at the station」を補いました。
sen.e: In old times, in the Usuitoge Line, all the passenger train were stopped for a long time at the station because attachment and release of the bank engine were operated there (see Usui Toge Railway).
sen.cmt: In old time を In old times に修正しました。passanger を passenger に修正しました。「（碓氷峠鉄道参照）」訳漏れのため、See Usui Toge Railway を補って対応しました。
sen.e: In old times, in the Usuitoge Line, all the passenger train were stopped for a long time at the station because attachment and release of the bank engine were operated there (see Usui Toge Railway).

sen.j: そのような鉄道駅自体の特殊性があったため、信越本線横川駅 (群馬県)の釜飯駅弁が有名であった。
sen.e: Because of such unique circumstance of the train station, Kamameshi train lunch of Yokogawa Station, Shinetsu Main Line (Gunma Prefecture) was popular.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Because of such unique circumstance of the train station, Kamameshi ekiben of Yokogawa Station, Shinetsu Main Line (Gunma Prefecture) was popular.
sen.cmt: train lunch を ekiben に修正しました。
sen.e: Because of such unique circumstance of the train station, Kamameshi ekiben of Yokogawa Station, Shinetsu Main Line (Gunma Prefecture) was popular.

sen.j: 以下の例に示すように今では日本各地の駅に見られる。
sen.e: Today, kamameshi is seen everywhere in Japan as follows.
Today, kamameshi is seen everywhere in Japan as follows.
Today, kamameshi is seen everywhere in Japan as follows.

sen.cmt: Hamanatsu を Hamamatsu に修正しました。

sen.j: - ウナギ釜飯 （加熱式容器）
- 武田氏陣中鍋めし （1967年発売）
sen.e: Takeda-shi jinchu (Takeda saumurai family at the front) kamameshi (first sold in 1967)
Takeda-shi jinchu (Takeda saumurai family at the front) kamameshi (first sold in 1967)
Takeda-shi jinchu (Takeda saumurai family at the front) kamameshi (first sold in 1967)

sen.cmt: Obuchizawa を Kobuchizawa に修正しました。

sen.j: - 山菜鶏釜めし、山のふもとのとり釜めし、炭火焼地鶏釜めし、アワビの釜飯
sen.e: Sansai-tori (wild vegetables and chicken) kamameshi, Yama-no-fumoto no tori-kamameshi (the chicken Kamameshi served at the foothill), Sumibi-yaki jidori (grilled local cheken) kamameshi, abalone kamameshi

Sansai-tori (wild vegetables and chicken) kamameshi, Yama no fumoto no tori kamameshi (chicken Kamameshi served at the foothill), Sumibiyaki jidori (grilled local chicken) kamameshi, awabi (abalone) kamameshi

Sansai-tori (wild vegetables and chicken) kamameshi, Yama no fumoto no tori kamameshi (chicken Kamameshi served at the foothill), Sumibiyaki jidori (grilled local chicken) kamameshi, awabi (abalone) kamameshi

sen.cmt: Whales を Kujira (whale) に修正しました。
Yoikokawa を Yokokawa に修正しました。

sen.e: Toge-no kamameshi (the kamameshi served at a mountain pass) (first sold in 1958)
Toge no kamameshi (kamameshi served at a mountain pass) (first sold in 1958)
sen.cmt: 前半部を修正しました。
sen.e: Toge no kamameshi (kamameshi served at a mountain pass) (first sold in 1958)

sen.j: - 越後国釜飯（山の幸）、越後釜飯（海の幸）
sen.cmt: prefecture を Prefecture に修正しました。
Takada を Takayama に修正しました。
matsutake を Matsutake に修正しました。

sen.e: Inadani sansai(wild vegetables of Inadani) kamameshi
Inadani sansai (wild vegetables of Inadani) kamameshi
